subject: Photography
title: The Power of Negative Space
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Power of Negative Space.

hook.text: Empty space isn't wasted space. In photography, nothing can say everything.

buildup.text: Negative space is the area around your subject. It provides breathing room and draws attention to what matters.

discovery.text: A small bird against a vast sky. A person walking across an empty beach. The space creates the emotion.

twist.text: Too much negative space feels lonely. Too little feels cramped. The ratio controls the mood entirely.

climax.text: Negative space is one of the most underused tools in photography. Beginners fear emptiness; masters embrace it.

punchline.text: Sometimes the most powerful element is nothing at all.

quiz.question: What is negative space in a photograph?
options: The empty area surrounding the main subject
